required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Segmentation of Structural Abnormalities in Chronic Lung Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Segmentation of Structural Abnormalities in Chronic Lung Diseases

collaborator.agency: Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, France
Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

brief_summary.textblock: Lung structural abnormalities are complex, time-consuming, and may lack reproducibility to evaluate visually on CT scans. The study's aim is to perform automated recognition of structural abnormalities in CT scans of patients with chronic lung diseases by using dedicated software.

detailed_description.textblock:
Three chronic lung diseases will constitute the target of the study, by using retrospective data from each lung disease:
- Cystic fibrosis
- Asthma and COPD
- Interstitial lung diseases
Dedicated algorithms will be developped for each disease condition.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of inclusion until the date of final quantification, assessed up to 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Correlations and comparisons with other biomarker of the disease severity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of inclusion until the date of final quantification, assessed up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of quantitative measurement with pulmonary function

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of inclusion until the date of final quantification, assessed up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of quantitative measurement at two time points

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of inclusion until the date of final quantification, assessed up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of measurements when performed twice

arm_group.description: This group is dedicated to developing an automated algorithm
This group is dedicated to testing the performance of an automated algorithm
This group is dedicated to assessing the clinical validity of the measurement in an independent validation cohort

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic lung disease and a Clinical examination, pulmonary function test, and CT acquired during an annual routine follow-up

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with chronic lung disease and clinical examination, pulmonary function test, and CT acquired during a routine follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
- In the Clinical Validation group, patients with exacerbation or part of the other groups
